alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Clark; Fayette; Harrison; Nicholas; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Scott, Clark, Bourbon, Nicholas, northeastern Fayette and Harrison Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 940 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Fairview to near Georgetown. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Carlisle around 950 AM EDT. Paris around 1000 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bourbon; Clark; Fayette; Harrison; Nicholas; Scott
